Artificial Intelligence and Sustainability: Innovations in Business and Managerial Practices

This research monograph, published in 2025 by the SBS Swiss Business School in Zurich, Switzerland, focuses on the intersection of Artificial Intelligence and Sustainability, specifically examining innovations within business and managerial practices. The publication represents a thematic collection of international significance, aiming to contribute to the ongoing discourse surrounding the topic. The book is spearheaded by Prof. Dr. Bert Wolfs as Academic Dean, Prof. Marijana Karanfiloska as Dean of Administration and Finance, and Prof. Dr. Milos Petkovic as Head of Research. Ms. Kristina Jordanova handled the cover and design. The ISBN is 978-3-033-11071-7. The SBS Swiss Business School holds all rights to the publication, prohibiting reproduction without prior written permission. Interested parties seeking to reproduce content outside the scope of permitted usage should contact the school at the provided address. The document clearly outlines the editorial team and the publisher's details, emphasizing the importance of this research in the context of evolving sustainability strategies within businesses and management. It‚Äôs a collection of papers of international significance, suggesting a broad scope of research and analysis related to AI's role in promoting sustainable practices.

Key Concepts:

  • Artificial Intelligence and Sustainability: Innovations in Business and Managerial Practices
  • Timely contribution to the evolving discourse
  • Research Monograph
  • The potential of AI in HRM, specifically boosting employee wellbeing and engagement.
  • The IRAML Model (Innovation-Relationship-AI Model-Learning) as a framework.
  • Exploring employee engagement and wellbeing within hybrid work environments.
  • Convergence of AI and sustainable finance offers a solution to limitations of traditional financial analysis.
  • AI technologies can analyze unstructured ESG data to provide deeper insights into company practices.
  • AI can be used to detect greenwashing and ensure the credibility of sustainability claims.
  • AI enhances predictive analytics for sustainability-related risks and opportunities.
